website_summaries.verdict: These TheraBand Aquafins let you change the strength and resistance of your workout by adjusting the fin angles.
pros: One-size-fits-all cuffs and Predator fins made of soft Santoprene rubber
Can be worn on ankles or wrists
Adjust drag and resistance by rotating fins
Includes mesh carrying case and detailed instructions
cons: Customers with larger ankles may want to try a different cuff

customer_reviews.title: Great resistance fins for pool workout
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for myself for resistance exercising in a pool. I had a hip replacement that I needed to exercise and rehab but my knee arthritis hampered my ability to exercise on land. Working out in the pool alleviated the aggravation of the arthritis of my knees. The Aquafins provide a great resistance workout to rehab my hip and strengthen my legs to help support my knees better. I definitely found these to be beneficial and wold recommend to anyone looking for a low impact strengthening program in a pool.
customer_reviews.author: Ken P.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Comes with ventilated storage bag and instructions and suggestions. They are a lot of fun and work. Boy were my muscles sore after the first day. My advice is to go slow at first. Easy to overdue it when nice and cool exercising in a pool.
customer_reviews.author: natural

customer_reviews.title: bothersome ankle rash
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I have is that the velcro straps rubs my ankles raw. I would like to use them more often but the straps never seem tight enough around my ankles even after getting them wet first. So then they move around rubbing my ankles raw. Has this happened to anyone else? Any suggestions? I'm thinking I may need to wear socks to cover my ankles when exercising in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Diane R. Mckay

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended. My full workout at the lake only takes ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these Fins when I bought my Hydro-Tone Bells. Have been using them for about 2 months now and can feel the difference in my legs strength and toning, right up to the butt. Highly recommended. My full workout at the lake only takes a half an hour. They are very secure around the ankles and offer decent resistance. The fins are on very securely and I've never had an issue with anything coming apart. Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy

customer_reviews.title: OK for thinner ankles, or for wrists
customer_reviews.text: I have large ankles and the Velcro straps are simply not long enough to use on them. Even if I added longer straps, the plastic front part would be uncomfortable on my legs because the curve is too narrow. It would be great if they came in a larger size. As it is, I'll use them on my wrists so I don't have to hold those foam dumbbells; gripping them hard enough makes my fingers go numb and this should help.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: ... PT -mostly for my knee/hip ordeals and they worked wonderfully. I used them one at a time for ...
customer_reviews.text: I was able to use these in PT -mostly for my knee/hip arthritist/osteoporosis ordeals and they worked wonderfully. I used them one at a time for my specific exercises.So as soon as I was done with PT I bought these to use at my local pool on my own and plan to use them during water walking and such.They DO work wonderfully and add resistance to your work outs.I cannot say enough great comments about these things,they DO work!! You won't regret buying them.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for rehabilitation and for a strong lean bod
customer_reviews.text: Great product for physical therapy to rehabilitate my knee before and after meniscus surgery. It’s like riding a bike in the water and I use a tube from Amazon around my chest to hold me up in the pool. Also works biceps, triceps and back resulting in a defined strong lean look. Note: you’re muscles will be strong and defined but not thick. I prefer the defined strong lean look. It’s a personal preference. Item comes with exercise instructions. Very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ambriel

customer_reviews.title: Will strengthen leg, thigh and butt, if you are not too lazy.
customer_reviews.text: I underwent a surgery and used these for exercises in the water 3 months before and 3 months after the operation. They don't do the thing for you, but if you are not too lazy, they have a very good effect in strengthening your leg thigh and butt muscles. Still use them today form time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Torn strap, bad luck? Bad quality? Who knows?
customer_reviews.text: Velcro strap tore off. I have been the only user to try and rehab my knee. I return window was on May 27th, so now I am stuck with them. I bought another brand locally and they seem better quality. If you buy these I hope they last longer for you than they did with me.
customer_reviews.author: D.  Miller

customer_reviews.title: Mother in law still raves about this product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my mother in law. She still raves about them. She uses them regularly for pool exercises at home. I would recommend putting them on before getting into the water, especially if you are putting them on your ankles.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Compact, comfortable and effective for a great workout!
customer_reviews.text: I opened the package and went straight to the pool to try them out. They are comfortable and stay on securely. They are also fun to use and provide great resistance for upper and lower body, also waist and abs. They are also compact and discreet to use in the pool when there are people around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great workout but didn’t feel like it.
customer_reviews.text: Great water resistant exercise. Coupled with the water saddle I paddles around my pool for an hour an didn’t feel like exercise. Exercise level, Like riding a bike up hill but in the comfort of water.
customer_reviews.author: Renee H.

customer_reviews.title: These are great for exercise
customer_reviews.text: These are great for exercise, but difficult to walk and maneuver in pool with these on; difinitely could not swim. great for wrist but velco hard to manage with arthritis. Seniors would need help putting these on.
customer_reviews.author: Guido

customer_reviews.title: Useful product.
customer_reviews.text: They are very comfortable and easy to use. Although on the expensive side the quality is excellent and have been a great addition to our pool workout!
customer_reviews.author: 4x4s

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful find.
customer_reviews.text: Due to water temperature, I've only been in my pool three times this season. My reason for having the pool built was to provide a way for aquatic exercise for arthritis. These fins are not the easiest to wear, but I've managed to develop exercise routines for my legs by turning them in different directions to change resistance. A wonderful find.
customer_reviews.author: eusrIMHO

customer_reviews.title: Worth The Price!
customer_reviews.text: Really work well for my pool running and back swimming exercises that I use for strengthening my post-op hip and knee replacements. Have been using them now after my official post-op rehab is over and no doubt will continue to as part of my swimming workout that I have made part of my exercise routine. Easier to get on than foam slip on resistance swim shoes---much easier! Worth the expense. I use them with four pounds each shoulder weights and a swim floatation belt. My old workout using foam shoes and foam hand weights plus belt to run laps in pool is now able to be achieved in half the time.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte O. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: the velcro is not long enough to go around my ...
customer_reviews.text: the velcro is not long enough to go around my ankle and I dont have fat ankles !!! whats up with that
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Poor

customer_reviews.title: Buy them
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Creates an impressive amount of resistance. Has helped me greatly in my rehab
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gives a great water work out
customer_reviews.text: If there were 10 stars I would give them all 10. I use them on my arms first them move to my ankles, first with the fins front and back then rotate to fins on each side. Gives a great water work out.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Powell

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to put on and to use
customer_reviews.text: I could not manage them at all. They did not provide any stability in the water I still have them and want to return them if I can
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Sabatini

customer_reviews.title: Achieves the purpose
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapist suggested this for pool exercises after my bilateral total knee replacement surgery. It's a gentle way to work on my strength and flexibility, even in a hot tub once the pool closes for the season. It does the job. My ankles are a bit swollen, so the fit is a little tight there--they really seem more designed for wrists--but i manage. I'd just better not gain any weight or swell more there, or the velcro won't close!
customer_reviews.author: auntie

customer_reviews.title: Love the fins
customer_reviews.text: I use them for my legs during aqua class. Great workout
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's worth the price of this equipment
customer_reviews.text: I love the results I got from using this in the pool. My arms and my legs are more firmer.
customer_reviews.author: angelina spena

customer_reviews.title: Effective exercise
customer_reviews.text: But watch it if you have arthritis in hips/knees. I have hip & knee arthritis in the same leg. Put these on, then I walked 20x around a above ground pool (about a 28' length pool, 4.5' deep). For comparison, I am not an Ironman triathlete, but could ride a mtn bike 3 miles on flat ground in 23 minutes. However, I was very sore from arthritis after using these fins in the pool, so much so, I needed a walking stick to walk, until the pain subsided in 1/2 hr. Be careful! I think I am going to cut these fins down to a smaller length, my arthritis could not take it.
customer_reviews.author: An Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These little charmers work wonders on sagging arms and great for the legs
customer_reviews.author: Pamela B.

customer_reviews.title: I used these during PT and loved them, just had to have my own for ...
customer_reviews.text: I used these during PT and loved them, just had to have my own for travel. Not to bad to put into a suitcase and excerise anywhere you go.
customer_reviews.author: ShabX2

customer_reviews.title: great way to exercise
customer_reviews.text: I am using these to strengthen my arms and legs while in my pool. I am noticing an improvement already.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: love these, have helped w my exercise in the pool alot
customer_reviews.author: Pam Rohrig

customer_reviews.title: a good addition to pool workout tool
customer_reviews.text: The Thera-band Aquafins provided the right amount of resistance to improve the pool workout. I am not a fan of Velcro fasteners but find the fitting of the fin very comfortable. Only time will tell how durable the product is and if the Velcro will hold up
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: AWSOME !
customer_reviews.text: I have these for 6 years absolutely great investment I used them everyday still fit and hold tight .
customer_reviews.author: Sprig

customer_reviews.title: These aqua fins are a must for a total water workout!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a difference these aqua fins have made in adding them to my aquatic aerobics. I started seeing and feeling more muscle tone immediately!
customer_reviews.author: Debbee Clark

customer_reviews.title: I use these all of the time for water jogging ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these all of the time for water jogging. They do increase resistance, but not to an unreasonable degree. Velcro straps are sometimes difficult to loosen.
customer_reviews.author: JCS

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart
customer_reviews.text: After many uses the fin (yellow part) fell off and was lost. It's a great water resistance product; however for the cost thought it should last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Cate Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a pair for about 6 years. Used them almost daily, but with time the Velcro has lost its grip and the rubber cushion broke. Since they do not offer a rebuild kit, I got another set. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: ouch
customer_reviews.text: The fins are prone to jab ankles and calves when walking or swimming. I have only used them twice so will keep trying. They are a bit difficult to put on with the heavy velcro straps sticking to each other, but once on they are solid for me. They arrived on time, but I cannot say I would highly recommend them for exercise in the water.
customer_reviews.author: John Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my Aquafins 3xwk in a heated pool. I am very pleased.There is some added resistance but not enough to negatively impact my exercise program. I have a disease similar to MS and leg wealness is an ongoing problem.
customer_reviews.author: Lakegirl13

customer_reviews.title: Perfect after hip operation!
customer_reviews.text: İt was perfect for me after hip replacement surgery to strenghten my muscles around the hip
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: not as useful as I thought
customer_reviews.text: Tough to use and the bands tend to move too much
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: but these are by far the best fins I've tried
customer_reviews.text: The strap runs a little small for my ankles and these only come in one size. I've tried others, but these are by far the best fins I've tried. My last pair lasted about a year and a half (using 3 times a week) before the strap broke.
customer_reviews.author: Margo's Red Light Fiction District

customer_reviews.title: toning and stretching best used for
customer_reviews.text: seems great for me in pool to stretch. made well. I look like wonder woman.
customer_reviews.author: groovy girl

customer_reviews.title: Great for exercise
customer_reviews.text: I use it because of medical recommendation, exercising in a swimming pool. It is versatile, well built and effective, has a good grip.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Cool Product
customer_reviews.text: Very cool product. Wish I had deeper waters to try them out in but will during the summer. They are nice for side leg lifts
customer_reviews.author: LBUFF

customer_reviews.title: great PT tool
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapists had not seen these, and loved that I purchased and brought them to sessions. I continute to use them at the YMCA, and believe they have been extremely helpful in the quest to build up strength after my knee replacement, and generally.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Blixt

customer_reviews.title: Gives a nice workout.
customer_reviews.text: Help get the most out of the workout I do. I even flip them parallel to get extra for jogging in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for Physical Therapy Exercises
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapist recommended I purchase these. Unfortunately they cost about $10 more than what she said they would. Luckily Amazon didn't charge for shipping which kept the cost a bit more in line with what she said they would cost. She claims they will last forever. The straps and velcro do seem very strong. So far they have enabled me to do my PT exercises in the water with more resistance. No compliants except for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: B Pa

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: This product I wish I had passed on They are too difficult to use compared to comparable products. If on your legs too clumsy and haven't tried them on my arms.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lummis

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I use these all the time and am very happy with the results. Strong thighs and calfs along with my arms.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Trahanovsky

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Used them as part of a physical therapy regiment and decided to buy some so I could continue after my PT ended. Having Rheumatoid Arthritis I am limited in what I can do exercise wise so I do water exercises. These are perfect for added resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: I particularly like that I don't have to hold onto an object
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the aquafins for exercise in my backyard pool. I particularly like that I don't have to hold onto an object, as my hands start to hurt if I do it for too long. I find that using them on one ankle and wrist on the same side allows me to hold onto the side of the pool for balance. I also like using them on my wrists while jogging in the pool. I do wish they gave more resistance, tho. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: konagal

customer_reviews.title: As I expected them
customer_reviews.text: They're good and very useful. As I expected them. I use them in the pool fail and do not regret buying them.
customer_reviews.author: bedam

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These will give you a great workout in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: K. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Love this Aquafins
customer_reviews.text: Love this Aquafins. Very good for working resistance in water. Good for workout or Aquatherapy. A lot of aqua therapist use this aquafins. Material is very good, it comes with velcro and comfortable. Depend how you workout you gonna feel the resistance and work on your legs.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: I love that they are so universal
customer_reviews.text: These really work! I love that they are so universal. You really feel the resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Freuler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Gives just the right resistance to increase deep water workout! Comfortable and easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Tapes sticky not carefully secured and this prevents the comfortable use.
customer_reviews.author: Amenfox

customer_reviews.title: Aqua Fins
customer_reviews.text: good product, i use it every chance i get in the pool. I would recommend it to my friends to increase endurance and strenght.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce McClue,III

customer_reviews.title: Big Bang Water Workout
customer_reviews.text: I was introduced to these when I did aqua therapy after surgery on my knee. I use the exercises I learned in therapy and get a wonderful workout with these and aqua weights. They're adjustable and pretty comfortable. Great for working on knee and hip flexors!
customer_reviews.author: MamaK68

customer_reviews.title: Aquafins
customer_reviews.text: Aquafins were recommended by my physical therapist following a hip replacement because I was already doing pool therapy and needed help with balance and building muscle strength. The added resistance is making me stronger. As for purchasing, I tried to buy them directly from Theraband and they quoted a $60.00 cost. I ordered them from Amazon for around $40.00. They arrived quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara S. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with no issues, just hoping that the other set of fins would have come with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bridgetaz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are the thing to have,if you work out in the pool
customer_reviews.author: Gypse23

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: These fins work as exceptional resistance tools to strengthen arms, legs and core!! I use them with many of my clients.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with durability
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in March and liked them a lot- thought they provided a good level of resistance. But after less than a dozen uses, the rivets on one fin just pulled out of the plastic rendering them useless.
customer_reviews.author: Lair Hill PDX

customer_reviews.title: The straps were getting badly worn so I was delighted that I could find the exact same product on ...
customer_reviews.text: I used the exact same product for seven years for my pool therapy. The straps were getting badly worn so I was delighted that I could find the exact same product on Amazon and didn't need to search the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Carol S. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Very Bad
customer_reviews.text: I responded to fast the strap can be cut so it will fit a small wrist? Other than that the unit appears to perform okay
customer_reviews.author: Very Bad

customer_reviews.title: Love it, quiet and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Love it, quiet and easy to clean. Took a few days for the cat to get used to it. Now he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: arabrabaz

customer_reviews.title: aquafins
customer_reviews.text: as always, I find what I need on Amazon. the aquafins arrived as promised from BigFlySports. it was an easy, efficient purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: de

product_meta.title: TheraBand Aquafins Aquatic Exercise Kit for Water Resistance Training for Upper/Lower Body, Pool Physical Therapy, Water Aerobics Equipment, 2 Fins, Mesh Bag, and Quick Start Exercise Instructions
product_meta.description: The Aquafins Aquatic Exercise Kit will introduce you to a whole new way to work out in the water. The unique, one-size-fits-all cuffs and Predator Fins are made of soft Santoprene rubber for strength and flexibility, and can be worn comfortably on the wrists or ankles for full body conditioning. Each kit contains 2 cuffs, 4 Predator Fins, a mesh carrying case and detailed instructions for toning and strengthening legs and lower back, inner and outer thighs, arms, chest and upper back.
feature_bullets: Work out in the water and tone and strengthen legs and lower back, inner and outer thighs, arms, chest and upper back
One-size-fits-all cuffs and Predator Fins are made of soft Santoprene rubber for strength and flexibly and can be worn comfortably on the wrists or ankles for full body conditioning
Drag resistance is adjusted by rotating the fins
Helps with arthritis or use following hip replacement or knee replacement to increase endurance and strength
Each kit contains 2 cuffs, 4 Predator Fins, a mesh carrying case and detailed instructions

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
